reviews.title: Below Average For Marriott!
reviews.text: Well, when you think Marriot you generally think quailty right? Not the case with the Albany Marriot. I only stay there for one night and it's a good thing it wasn't any longer. Maybe I'm being to harsh. Let me put it this way, it a step above Motel 6. The carpet in my room seemed very dirty and it seemed way over priced for the area. There are a dozen or so hotels on Wolf St. really close to the airport. I would check others before I checked into Albany Marriot!

reviews.title: Typical Marriott
reviews.text: Typical Corp Traveler type of Marriott. Close to airport (sometimes I think too close). A little worn (carpets, coffee maker, etc). However generally in good shape. Only Issue I had/have is with airplane noise - its quite close the glide path for the airport and if the wind is running west to east (typically it is) the planes approach very close to the hotel - if you are a light sleeper, request a lower floor facing north. There are many properties to choose from the airport area not that there are any hilton/sheraton/hyatts - and the Marriott is much better than the Courtyard across the street.

We stayed here one night in September. We stayed in a room on the Concierge Floor which was very large, although a small bathroom. The hotel can be subject to low flying aircraft from the Albany airport.
reviews.title: A Typical Marriott
Stay here, but don't stay long...
reviews.text: Check-in was pleasant and efficient. The Concierge Club offered really nothing but cheese and crackers and some nuts for the cocktail hour (honor bar for cocktails) and some cookies from 7-10pm. Likewise, the continental breakfast in the club was sparse with some muffins, bagels, and cold cereal. No pastries or croissants. We were disappoited with these offerings.

reviews.title: First Class!
reviews.text: This is a decent hotel, but is overpriced for the area and services offered. Rooms are nice, there is a small workout area, and pool. The restaurant is adequate, but nothing special. One feature I would recommend is the Starbucks in house. You can get a good cup of Starbucks joe, and a muffin for only $3.50.
If you are a road warrior and need to wash some clothing, this hotel has a nice suprise for you. Otherwise, it is just a bland hotel in a bland city.
reviews.title: utterly mediocre - but onsite washer dryer was a nice touch

reviews.text: I must confess that we got this hotel cheap on Priceline ($48) - but it was fabulous. We were just passing through the area.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: Our room had the most comfortable king size bed I've ever slept in. (Really!) Wonderful white cotton duvet, and fitted sheets (yeah). All furniture and carpeting were brand new. Our room had a nice pull-out love seat (perfect for a kid traveling with parents), a stuffed chair, a nice desk, good TV. All spacious.
reviews.title: Very nice, if a bit overpriced

reviews.text: I did not notice any night time airplane noise.
